availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Duke R. Hendrick (Barren County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Hendricks. Married to Selena Greer Hendrick in Barren County, Kentucky, on September 21, 1829. Father of Ann F. Hendrick, Kemp H. Hendrick, Malinda J. Hendrick, Benjamin F. Hendrick, George W. Hendrick, Thomas J. Hendrick, Leonidas E. Hendrick, and Beverly Leonus Hendrick. Farmer in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 1, p. 329A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Elk Springs, p. 122B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Barren County Marriages, Film 000209752.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994027, Barren County Births, p. 9.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 13746.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Barren County Wills, vol. 3-4, 1828-1884, p. 357-358.
